main.name: Alvacir Wesley Kalatai Alberti
main.occupation: Student, Web and Mobile Developer and aspiring Data Scientist
main.description: As the huge tagline up there says, I love knowledge - learning new things is essential for me to live, and that's what I seek to do every day, be it on the internet, building something or observing, my life is a constant quest for learning. My passions are coding/technology and nature/biology, my ultimate goal is to be successful in the agricultural technology area.
main.bio: Born and raised in the heartland of the Brazilian state Paraná, I grew up amongst the nature, climbing trees, riding horses up and down cliffs, walking and biking in the woods and playing games in the dirt with my friends. I discovered my passion for coding and technology as soon as I moved to the capital of the state, Curitiba, when I just fell in love with coding and technology in general, but this didn't mean I forgot about my roots, my drive is knowledge and my goal is to ultimately learn new and exciting ways to implement new and cutting edge technologies in agriculture and livestock husbandry, one step at a time.
main.contactmessage: I love challenges, I believe that is through challenges that you can truly be motivated and effectively really learn new things, if you have a challenge for me or would like to know me better, chat a little maybe, please get in touch!

resume.skillmessage: The things I love to do:

education.degree: Computer Science with Embedded Systems & Robotics and Data Engineering concentrations
education.description: This was possible through a pioneer program that PUCPR started to offer in Brazil in 2018 called "American Academy," that alongside KSU, offered the full American experience while still in Brazil, with all the classes and professors we would have in America, and after the two initial years, finish off the degree in the United States. This was the perfect opportunity to, as I wanted, get deeper in the computer science area.

education.school: Pontifícia Universidade Católica do Paraná - PUCPR
education.degree: Engenharia de Controle e Automação (Control and Automation Engineering)
education.description: I was able to clearly see where I wanted to go after I started to work with software development. My boss at the time had graduated in this course some years prior and he was my main incentive to pursue this career. Here I started to get a real grasp of what coding really meant, I learnt how to code embedded systems, design circuit boards, robotics, industrial automation, internet of things, artificial intelligence and so much more. But about three years in the course, I still felt that this wasn't enough, I wanted to get deeper in the programming scene as I wasn't much fond of the engineering stuff, so through PUCPR I found the path that I am pursuing today.

education.school: Universidade Estadual de Ponta Grossa - UEPG
education.description: This was my first step into pursuing my lifelong dream of working with the earth, unfortunately, it wasn't what I expected. Professors still were teaching the way they had for more than decades and new technology wasn't brought up at all. That wasn't what I envisioned for my future, so I started to search for better opportunities.

work.title: Lead Android Developer
work.description: Here I got my first taste for coding. I entered the company as the errands boy, getting computer parts and picking up faulty equipment from our clients. After some time, my boos let me experiment with fixing computers, it was better, but not really what I wanted to do there. My boss surprised me one day, when out of the blue, he asked me if I could code something for him to see what I had learnt in college up until then. Apparently, he was pleased with the simple command line application I made and asked me to make a simple app in C#, using Windows Forms (which I knew nothing about), after a week or so, I managed to struggle my way into finishing it and as happened with the previous project, he was pleased and wanted more, and then, from that day forward, my thirst for learning how to code everything just grew and grew.

work.title: Phone Representative
work.description: This was my go at sales. As soon as I moved in to Curitiba, I got a job at BTCC selling their services through the phone. I managed to get the top marks consumer care and was acknowledged by my supervisors as the best representative in my time for the time I was there. Although I liked the experience of getting in touch in customers, talking to them, offering our services and listening to what they had to say, the work I did wasn't exciting and I didn't had the opportunity to learn anything new there, so after a short stay I quit.

projects.title: CRWN Store
projects.category: A e-commerce website I made to hone my React skills.

projects.title: Caramel Camel Coffee
projects.category: An e-commerce website I started to learn more about APIs, web development and management.

projects.title: Natours
projects.category: *Ongoing project* - I chose to focus heavily in CSS in this one, to improve my design skills.

projects.title: UN Admin Web
projects.category: *Ongoing project* - Commissioned by the company I used to work on.

projects.title: UCMobile
projects.category: An Android app I created while working in UnderControl. It's used for taking orders in restaurants with a smartphone.

projects.title: UN Relatórios
projects.category: An Android companion app to the ERP developed by UnderControl. It's used for visualization of data on the go.

projects.title: More
projects.category: Check out my Github for more projects.

testimonials.text: It was a pleasure working with Wesley for more than two years. He surprised me more times than I can count.
testimonials.user: Kauem Fuchs - Owner of UnderControl Software
